H0.text: Phospholipids form the two layers that make up the cell membrane.

H1.text: Chlorophyll is the substance that the cell membrane consists of two layers of.

H2.text: Epidermis is the two layers that constitute the cell membrane.

H3.text: Filaments form the two layers of the cell membrane.

A4.text: The cell membrane is a lipid bilayer, usually consisting of phospholipids and glycolipids

A5.text: The cell membrane consists primarily of a thin layer of amphipathic phospholipids that spontaneously arrange so that the hydrophobic 'tail' regions are isolated from the surrounding water
